item.title: Derivatives of Measures
item.description: We begin with a simple, theorem whose main purpose is to motivate the definitions that follow. 7.1 Theorem Suppose \(\mu\) is a complex Borel measure on \(R^1\) and \[ f(x)=\mu((-\infty, x)) \quad\left(x \in R^1\right) . \] If \(x \in R^1\) and \(A\) is a complex number, each of the following two statements implies the other: \(f\) is differentiable at \(x\) and \(f^{\prime}(x)=A\). To every \(\epsilon>0\) corresponds a \(\delta>0\) such that \[ \left|\frac{\mu(I)}{m(I)}-A\right|<\epsilon \]
